metadata.synopsis: Alfira has seen her friends, people she considered family, dragged screaming into the nigh. She is upset and only just holding it together. She asks the player to save the prisoners in Moonrise.
metadata.how_to_trigger:
Talk to Alfira in Haven (thanks captain obvious) !
----
loadlevel SCL_Main_A
goto -66 ; 141

9.speaker: Alfira
9.text: When I'm sure it's safe, I'll see about rounding people up to follow the light.

28.speaker: Alfira
28.text: Everyone else might welcome you with open arms, but stay the hells away from me you lute-smashing arsehole.

50.speaker: Alfira
50.text: Our group grows smaller and smaller. We've lost many, but we have you to thank for the ones who survived.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Trying to be grateful but still sounding a bit sad

31.speaker: Alfira
31.text: How did you do it? How did you get them out of that hellspit?

138.speaker: Player
138.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

73.speaker: Alfira
73.text: And your damn well good at it. Thank you - for everything.
73.context: NodeContext: grateful but a touch sad

16.speaker: Alfira
16.text: Then I'm glad we were lucky enough to meet you.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: You should be grateful I managed to save anyone at all.

15.speaker: Alfira
15.text: I am! Sorry - that came out wrong. Thank you - I know you did everything you could.
15.context: NodeContext: embarrassed - trying to find the right words

5.speaker: Alfira
5.text: It's a sad day to be giving this, but here.
5.context: InternalNodeContext: NEEDS REWARDNodeContext: Trying to be grateful but still sounding a bit sad

53.speaker: Alfira
53.text: The others should be in Baldur's Gate: safe, happy. To die like they did... they didn't deserve it.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Upset. Just barely holding it together.

59.speaker: Alfira
59.text: First cultists nearly murder us, and now we have a traitor on the inside? Can't we trust anyone?
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: frustrated and tired of being scared

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Just focus on getting through this.

127.speaker: Alfira
127.context: NodeContext: frustrated sigh but trying to rally herself

111.speaker: Alfira
111.text: I know - you've been there for us every step of the way. It's just all a bit much sometimes, you know?
111.context: NodeContext: relieved, trying to rally herself

121.speaker: Alfira
121.text: You're truly unpleasant sometimes, you know? Don't know why I bother.
121.context: NodeContext: More sad and disappointed than offended

71.speaker: Player
71.text: This anger you feel? This fear? Use it. Don't give in to it.

35.speaker: Alfira
35.text: My teacher always said emotions are to be felt - not feared.
35.context: NodeContext: Sad smile at the mention of your beloved teacher

115.speaker: Alfira
115.text: You're right. We can't give in - not now. Thank you.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: You think a few shadows could beat me?

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'm glad you made it too, it's one hell of a curse.

61.speaker: Alfira
61.text: It wasn't the curse that did us in.
61.context: NodeContext: Smile dropping. Horror entering her voice

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I see some familiar faces, but where's everyone else?

105.speaker: Alfira
105.text: We were ambushed out in the darkness - by cultists. We surrendered, but that wasn't enough for them.

11.speaker: Alfira
11.text: They lined us up like dogs. Asharak was with the kids, telling them it was gonna be all right.

22.speaker: Alfira
22.text: Maybe that's why they picked him. Told him to kneel...

125.speaker: Alfira
125.text: They took his eyes first. Then his tongue.

132.speaker: Alfira
132.text: Rolan, of all people, saved us.

32.speaker: Alfira
32.text: He said he stayed in the grove because of you, and I'm damn glad of it. Without him... well, none of us would be here.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I know - Rolan isn't happy with me.

37.speaker: Alfira
37.text: Can you blame him? His brother and sister are gone. He's... dealing with it as best he can. We all are.
37.context: NodeContext: worried for rolan. She's not chiding the player, merely trying to explain

136.speaker: Alfira
136.text: How do you do it? How do you keep going?
136.context: NodeContext: Lost. Looking for guidance, for reassurance.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Just take it one step at a time.

39.speaker: Alfira
39.text: You make it sound so easy - but I'll try.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I'll let you know when I figure it out.

23.speaker: Alfira
23.text: We're in the same boat, then? That's... somewhat of a comfort.
23.context: NodeContext: Sad smile but trying to end on a nice note

91.speaker: Alfira
91.text: You've done so much for us already, but I have to ask - the others might still be out there.

95.speaker: Alfira
95.text: If they're not dead, they're in Moonrise. And gods have mercy on anyone in that hellspit.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I'll do everything in my power to save them - you have my most solemn vow.

49.speaker: Alfira
49.text: Thank you. If anyone can manage it, you can.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'm sure they're fine. Probably being held for questioning.

43.speaker: Alfira
43.text: Maybe. Sorry, I shouldn't have said anything. You've enough on your plate.

1.speaker: Alfira
1.text: Just be careful out there, all right? I can't handle anyone else dying.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I cannot help - I have far greater evils to conquer. But your friends have survived worse - I am sure they will be fine.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I imagine the cultists are torturing them right now.

13.speaker: Alfira
13.text: Why would you say something like that? What is wrong with you? Actually - never mind.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Danger is my life - I wouldn't change it for the world.

110.speaker: Alfira
110.text: You're made of sterner stuff than me then.
110.context: NodeContext: Sad smile but trying to end on a nice note

0.speaker: Player
0.text: 'When the night is dark, stars shine brightest.' So keep on shining. It's going to be all right.

38.speaker: Alfira
38.text: 'Heart's Requiem', right? The hero survives a war and rebuilds her life - stronger than ever. A tale worth remembering - especially now.
38.context: NodeContext: Small laugh. a touch of delight among the grief

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Only the strong survive. You want to live? Focus on yourself.

102.speaker: Alfira
102.text: ...If you say so. But not everyone is as strong as you are.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: A strong weapon-arm and a bit of luck. That's all you need.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I take what I'm due and I don't look back.

117.speaker: Alfira
117.text: That sounds quite freeing - but I don't have that option, I'm afraid.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: To linger in the past is to condemn our future. Focus on the here and now.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: It helps to remember what is at stake - I fight for nature, for balance. I fight for life itself.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Danger is my life - there is no greater thrill for me than the hunt.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I don't complain constantly. It's very annoying.

47.speaker: Alfira
47.text: ...Never mind, then. Just - just leave me be.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: If he hadn't listened to me, maybe his brother and sister would still be here.

44.speaker: Alfira
44.text: Don't say that. When I think of what would have happened if Cal and Lia weren't there...
44.context: NodeContext: worried for rolan, cal and lia

120.speaker: Alfira
120.text: Yes. He shielded me and the kids while his brother and sister rushed the cultists.
120.context: NodeContext: Still horrified but also admiring what cal, lia and rolan did.

62.speaker: Alfira
62.text: Cal and Lia were dragged away, along with the others. Rolan isn't... taking it so well. None of us, to be honest.

2.speaker: Alfira
2.text: I don't feel lucky. I feel... I feel like I'm at the end of my rope.
2.context: NodeContext: Lost. Grieving. Looking for guidance, for reassurance.

83.speaker: Alfira
83.text: It just... it just never stops.

113.speaker: Alfira
113.text: Which...? Back in the grove, he ran drills with the kids. Wooden swords and the like. That seems like a lifetime ago now.

55.speaker: Alfira
55.text: Which...? He was on the quiet side, but had a heart of gold. Back in the grove, he'd kept an eye on the kids. Gods, that feels like a lifetime ago.

21.speaker: Alfira
21.text: Some of us fought back - or tried to. But it was hopeless.
21.context: NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

122.speaker: Alfira
122.text: All I could do was run.
122.context: NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

12.speaker: Alfira
12.text: That means a lot, coming from you. You always seem to take everything in your stride.
12.context: NodeContext: warmth but little bit of grief at the end

68.speaker: Alfira
68.text: It was that or get dragged to Moonrise.

107.speaker: Alfira
107.text: I know what I am and what I'm not - and I'm not ashamed of running. No matter what you think.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: What did the cultists do to the others?

128.speaker: Alfira
128.text: I don't know. It just... happened so quickly.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Only fools fight an ambush. Better to live and strike another day - preferably to the neck.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Wandering into the darkness was a stupid idea.

70.speaker: Alfira
70.text: And I regret it with every breath.

84.speaker: Alfira
84.text: I had to watch my friends, people who can barely hold a sword, try to fight a pack of murderous zealots.
84.context: NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

92.speaker: Player
92.text: I've seen a lot of nasty ambushes in my time - but that sounds among the worst. I'm sorry.

56.speaker: Alfira
56.text: They lined us up like dogs. Ikaron was with the kids, telling them it was gonna be all right.

101.speaker: Alfira
101.text: They lined us up like dogs. Someone told them to rot in the Nine Hells, that we weren't going anywhere.

88.speaker: Alfira
88.text: You're all right! Thank goodness, I was worried they'd got you too.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing upNodeContext: Relieved. Trying to be cheerful but you're upset, and just holding it together.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I heard what happened - that people were taken to Moonrise.

67.speaker: Alfira
67.text: I keep replaying it... over and over in my head.
67.context: NodeContext: horrified - remembering how scared she was

129.speaker: Player
129.text: How about you? How are you holding up?

94.speaker: Alfira
94.context: NodeContext: Trying to put on a brave face but you are NOT all right.

139.speaker: Alfira
139.text: I still can't believe it. The cultists. The screams...
139.context: NodeContext: Hurt. Thinking back on how terrified she was

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Of course I am. As if there was any doubt.

134.speaker: Alfira
134.text: I'm afraid doubt is all I know these days.
134.context: NodeContext: Trying to put on a brave face but you are NOT all right.

93.speaker: Alfira
93.text: You're back! Is... is everything all right?
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing up NodeContext: Surprise and worry

42.speaker: Alfira
42.text: Damn it, no! Once we left that bloody grove, everything was supposed to be all right! We were supposed to be safe.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: I'm sorry, but the others? They didn't make it.

3.speaker: Alfira
3.text: I knew it. The moment you came through that door I just knew.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closing eyes, grief-stricken. Every word a loss.NodeContext: Closing eyes. Deep breathe. Mourful and heartbroken.

63.speaker: Alfira
63.text: They were good people - they deserved to die old and happy. Not in the hands of monsters.
63.context: NodeContext: Upset but trying to be sincere and grateful at the end

18.speaker: Alfira
18.text: But thank you - I'm sure you did what you could.

97.speaker: Alfira
97.text: That Flaming Fist seemed kind. I keep looking at everyone and wonder whose side they're really on...

106.speaker: Alfira
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Sincere and heartfelt

119.speaker: Alfira
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Mad at player, they either upset you or were kind of an ass to you

124.speaker: Alfira
124.text: With all this darkness, I'd forgotten what light, true blazing light, felt like. Thank you - we needed a bit of hope.

131.speaker: Alfira
131.text: You actually did it - you rescued them from Moonrise. How?
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: full of gratitude

79.speaker: Player
79.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

40.speaker: Alfira
40.text: If it was anyone else, I'd be sceptical - but you? You've more than earned the title of hero.
40.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

75.speaker: Alfira
75.text: By the time we get to the city, I'm gonna have an entire catalogue of songs about you.
75.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

45.speaker: Alfira
45.text: It's not much, but here - you deserve it.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Killing everyone who got in my way.

116.speaker: Alfira
116.text: I'm sorry it came to that. But if it was you or them, I'd pick you every time.

30.speaker: Alfira
30.text: I believe in ballads they call that 'talent' and 'courage'.
30.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

143.speaker: Alfira
143.text: I'm glad it was you who walked through that door. Thank you.
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Kindness and appreciation
